description: From jade (“worn-out horse”), possibly from Old Norse jalda (“mare”). Jade as a term of abuse for a woman dates from 1560.

adjectives.description: jaded (comparative more jaded, superlative most jaded)

entries.meaning: Bored or lacking enthusiasm, typically after having been over exposed to, or having consumed too much of something.
examples: Synonyms: cloyed, gorged, glutted, satiated, sated, surfeited

entries.meaning: Worn out, wearied, exhausted or lacking enthusiasm, due to age or experience.
examples: Synonyms: exhausted, fatigued, wearied; see also Thesaurus:fatigued

entries.meaning: Made callous or cynically insensitive, by experience.
simple past tense and past participle of jade
